medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until approximately 10 days before admission, when she reportedly had a high fever that resolved after 2 days. Six days before admission, her temperature rose as high as 40.3°C, with associated chills, rigors, diffuse urticaria, and pain in the chest, low back, and knees. The temperature was reportedly 38.9°C after ibuprofen the evening before admission, with symptoms continuing to worsen daily.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection diagnosed at age 15, substance-use disorder with a history of using injection drugs (heroin and cocaine), anxiety, axillary hyperhidrosis, cholelithiasis, vasomotor rhinitis, multiple skin abscesses, pneumonia, sinusitis, cystitis, pyelonephritis, back pain, and superficial thrombophlebitis of the left leg.
medical_history.family_history: Sister had thyroid disease; parents were well.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with a roommate, previously homeless. Worked with animals. Smoked cigarettes and infrequently drank alcohol. Traveled to Mexico the previous year.
